required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of the COVID-19 Vaccine (Recombinant, Inactivated) in Brazil
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II Double-blind, Randomized, Stepwise, Adaptive, Controlled Clinical Trial to Assess the Safety and Immunogenicity of the COVID-19 Vaccine (Recombinant, Inactivated) in Adults, in Brazil - ADAPTCOV.

brief_summary.textblock:
NDV-HXP-S is an inactivated COVID-19 vectored-vaccine virus using the Newcastle Disease Virus as basis and expressing S protein from SARS-CoV-2 stabilized in pre-fusion form with Hexapro technology.
This vaccine was successfully tested in non-clinical study with a good safety profile and eliciting neutralizing antibodies against SARS-CoV-2. Clinical testing is conducted by an international consortium including three different manufacturers. Butantan, in Brazil, is one of them.

detailed_description.textblock:
The present protocol aims, stepwise, to respond to several regulatory requirements to advance the clinical development of the product through a controlled, randomized, adaptive, adult clinical trial in stages. The results of the first stage, or Stage A, allow us to base the decision to move between two alternatives, called Alternative 1 and Alternative 2.
These alternatives guide on the progression or not of the clinical development of the product generated with the parental strain. In Alternative 1, the parental vaccine will continue its development if verified. In Alternative 2, the parental vaccine will be discontinued and a variant-based vaccine will be selected to continue development.
If Alternative 1 is followed, the parental vaccine will be compared directly against an active vaccine control in Stage B1 and in Stage C1 an additional evaluation of a variant-based vaccine will be made. However, Alternative 2, Stage B2 aims to evaluate vaccines based on variants to select one of them for direct comparison with an active vaccine control in Stage C2.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Stage A (blinding form) will verify the product safety and support the decision on the dose selection among 1 μg, 3 μg and 10 μg, based on the immune response assessment. These results will also explore the response against 2 variants of concern in SARS-CoV-2: γ and β. The scientific justification for these decisions will be approved by the regulatory agency before choosing Alternative 1 or 2 and progression to the next stage, either B1 or B2. Stage B1:to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic(Ho) immunogenicity. Stage C1, complementary to B1: to assess an immune response of the variant-based vaccine with the best heterotypic(He) immunogenicity among those assessed in B1. Stage B2:to assess the Ho and He immunogenicity response induced by each of the vaccines based on variants. Stage C2: comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in B2 and an active vaccine control.
study_design_info.masking_description: An electronic central randomization system will be used to designate the investigational product (IP) that each participant must receive. A team study non-blind, qualified member (nurse/pharmacist) will obtain the corresponding randomization, will separate the respective IP, will blind the product and deliver it to blind staff. The product will be in a syringe that is in a blister labeled with the sponsor's name, IP code, administration route, IP dose and expiration date. The study non-blind staff will not have contact with the participants, will not have access to identification data or any other involvement with the study, besides randomizing the participant, separating the syringe containing placebo or vaccine, checking if the information on the blister label corresponds the information on the cartridge label and the syringe is labeled with the clinical trial code, ID, corresponding visit and investigator's name. Blinding is maintained with the opacity of the label.

primary_outcome.description: Number and intensity of solicited local and systemic adverse reactions.
Percentage of positive SARS-CoV-2 pseudovirus neutralization assay in a participant with a baseline negative result.

secondary_outcome.description: Number, intensity, and relatedness of all unsolicited adverse reactions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: serious and medically-attended adverse reactions.
secondary_outcome.description: Number, intensity, and relatedness of serious adverse reactions
Number, intensity, and relatedness of events of special interest.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 28 days after the first vaccination, and 14 days after the second vaccination, and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months after first vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 Nucleocapsid protein and RBD

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity: Neutralization GMT of SARS-CoV-2 pseudovirus.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after the first vaccination, and 14 days after the second vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: Neutralization GMT against SARS-CoV-2 pseudovirus per age group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 28 days after the first vaccination, and 14 days after the second vaccination, and 3 months, 6 months, 9 months, and 12 months after first vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 Nucleocapsid protein and RBD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Exploratory Endpoints: Neutralization GMT of SARS-CoV-2 pseudovirus.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months, 6 months, 9 months, and 12 months after first vaccination in subjects.
secondary_outcome.description: Neutralization GMT against SARS-CoV-2 pseudovirus at 3 months, 6 months, 9 months, and 12 months after first vaccination in subjects.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days after first and second vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: Number and intensity of COVID-19 cases diagnosed.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S 1μg (Stage A)
arm_group.description: Stage A: Stage A will be the first use of the product in humans. A dose escalation will be performed with an interval of two days between each dose in a blinded form. The aim is to verify the product safety and support the decision on the dose selection among three alternatives, 1 μg, 3 μg and 10 μg, based on the immune response evaluation. These results will also explore the response against two variants of concern in SARS-CoV-2: γ and β.The scientific justification for these decisions will be approved by the regulatory agency before choosing Alternative (A) 1 or 2 and progression to the next stage, either B1 or B2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S 3μg (Stage A)
arm_group.description: Stage A: Stage A will be the first use of the product in humans. A dose escalation will be performed with an interval of two days between each dose in a blinded form. The aim is to verify the product safety and support the decision on the dose selection among three alternatives, 1 μg, 3 μg and 10 μg, based on the immune response evaluation. These results will also explore the response against two variants of concern in SARS-CoV-2: γ and β.The scientific justification for these decisions will be approved by the regulatory agency before choosing Alternative (A) 1 or 2 and progression to the next stage, either B1 or B2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S 10μg (Stage A)
arm_group.description: Stage A: Stage A will be the first use of the product in humans. A dose escalation will be performed with an interval of two days between each dose in a blinded form. The aim is to verify the product safety and support the decision on the dose selection among three alternatives, 1 μg, 3 μg and 10 μg, based on the immune response evaluation. These results will also explore the response against two variants of concern in SARS-CoV-2: γ and β.The scientific justification for these decisions will be approved by the regulatory agency before choosing Alternative (A) 1 or 2 and progression to the next stage, either B1 or B2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo (Stage A)
arm_group.description: The stage A is designed as a non-inferiority test comparing the three different doses and using placebo as a control.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine in 3 consecutive lots (Stage B) - Group B1a
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, no prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control (Stage B) - Group B1a
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, no prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine (Stage B) - Group B1b
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, with or without prior exposure to prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control (Stage B) - Group B1b
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, with or without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine (Stage B) - Group B1c
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1c: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control (Stage B) - Group B1c
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1c: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine simple dose (Stage B) - Group B1d
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, vaccinated more than 6 months ago.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control simple dose (Stage B) - Group B1d
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 18-59 years old, vaccinated more than 6 months ago.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine simple dose (Stage B) - Group B1d (60 years or more)
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 60 years or more, vaccinated more than 6 months ago.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control simple dose (Stage B) - Group B1d (60 years or more)
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1d: 60 years or more, vaccinated more than 6 months ago.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S variant γ vaccine (Stage B) - Group B1e
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1e: 18-59 years old, without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S variant β vaccine (Stage B) - Group B1e
arm_group.description: Stage B1 (Group B1, B1b, B1c, B1d and B1e) aims to compare the experimental parental vaccine with an active vaccine control in terms of homotypic immunogenicity. Participants of this group B1e: 18-59 years old, without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants in 3 consecutive lots (Stage C) - Group C1a
arm_group.description: Stage C1 (Groups C1a, C1b and C1c) is complementary to Stage B1 and seeks to assess an immune response of the variant-based vaccine with the best heterotypic immunogenicity (Hel) among those assessed in Stage B1 (Vaccines γ and β). Participants of this group C1a: 18-59 years old, without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants (Stage C) - Group C1b
arm_group.description: Stage C1 (Groups C1a, C1b and C1c) is complementary to Stage B1 and seeks to assess an immune response of the variant-based vaccine with the best heterotypic immunogenicity (Hel) among those assessed in Stage B1 (Vaccines γ and β). Participants of this group C1b: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants (Stage C) - Group C1c
arm_group.description: Stage C1 (Groups C1a, C1b and C1c) is complementary to Stage B1 and seeks to assess an immune response of the variant-based vaccine with the best heterotypic immunogenicity (Hel) among those assessed in Stage B1 (Vaccines γ and β). Participants of this group C1c: 18-59 years old

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants (Stage C) - Group C1c (60 years or more)
arm_group.description: Stage C1 (Groups C1a, C1b and C1c) is complementary to Stage B1 and seeks to assess an immune response of the variant-based vaccine with the best heterotypic immunogenicity (Hel) among those assessed in Stage B1 (Vaccines γ and β). Participants of this group C1c: 60 years or more

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S variant γ vaccine (Stage B) - Group B2a
arm_group.description: Stage B2 (Group B2a) aims to assess the homotypic and heterotypic response induced by each of the vaccines based on variants. Participants of this group B2a: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S variant β vaccine (Stage B) - Group B2a
arm_group.description: Stage B2 (Group B2a) aims to assess the homotypic and heterotypic response induced by each of the vaccines based on variants. Participants of this group B2a: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants in 3 consecutive lots (Stage C) - Group C2a
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2a: 18-59 years old, no prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control (Stage C) - Group C2a
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2a: 18-59 years old, no prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S vaccine based on variants (Stage C) - Group C2b
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2b: 18-59 years old, with or without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control (Stage C) - Group C2b
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2b: 18-59 years old, with or without prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NDV-HXP-S parental vaccine (Stage C) - Group C2c
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2c: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2c: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2c: 18-59 years old, with prior exposure to SARS-CoV-2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Vaccine Control simple dose (Stage C) - Group C2d
arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2c: 18-59 years old, vaccinated more than 6 months.

arm_group.description: Stage C2 (Groups C2a, C2b, C2c and C2d) will make a direct comparison between the experimental vaccine based on the variant selected in Step B2 and an active vaccine control. Participants of this group C2c: 60 years old or more, vaccinated more than 6 months.
